text: the shopping cart it's modest looks
conceal a precision-engineered marvel
this humble machine is so much more than
just a basket on wheels over a hundred
lightweight parts haul up to 350 pounds
of groceries 75 yards of toughened steel
cage coated in Teflon to increase its
endurance snap-on bumpers strong enough
to survive 30 mile an hour impacts
anti-static tires made from the same
material as roller coaster wheels to
prevent shocks and freewheeling but
forward-facing rear wheels inspired by a
car's effortless steering all engineered
to survive 35,000 shops in its lifetime
every cart must be tough enough to haul
heavy groceries for up to a decade each
new cart costs around $100 store owners
are keen to keep hold of everyone so
some have an ingenious trap to trip up
potential thieves as a cart crosses the
shop perimeter a cable hidden
underground wirelessly activates a motor
in the wheel smaller than a matchbox it
cranks a set of gears that force out
specialty
which lock the outer wheel in place the
teeth prevent the wheel from turning and
stop thieves in their tracks
